HR is not helpful.

pros: Pay is $956 per credit taught

pros: I love working for DMACC. People are very helpful when you need to find information across departments
cons: It's hard to get a full time position and when one does open, there is fierce competition--simply because everyone wants to work here.

job_title: Admissions Records Specialist in Des Moines, IA
pros: Good starting pay, room to move to different areas, friendly people.
cons: Lots of extra work, company financial spending on non-necessary things is apparent, the work flow is outdated.

review_title: It's a great place to work!
job_title: Student Services Specialist in Des Moines, IA
pros: Lots of opportunity to gain experience in many different areas. If you are willing to consistently work hard there's a life time of careers at your choosing. Hard work, dedication, flexibility and staying student focused will get noticed. Benefits are amazing!
cons: Pay has nothing to do with your performance, instead your pay is determined by your position (a grade system) so 2 employees with the same position and same number of years of employment are paid the same regardless if 1 does everything and the other does nothing. There are not enough employees on the student services side of the house--they do expect us to continue to do more with less and less. I've always wished they were more progressive, they have hung on to the good ol boys decisionmaking, disappoints me

pros: Pay, flexible schedule, central location
cons: You are treated like second class if you work part time, but base pay is good, never a raise or benefits at all

pros: The college offers great benefits such as health insurance.
cons: The organization is flat so it is difficult to move up.

pros: Great place to learn new technology
cons: Nothing Nothing Nothing Nothing Nothing

cons: Fascism and if you aren’t white, you are looked at as a thug

pros: amazing benefits and compensation. Great growth opportunities and ability to design your job.

pros: easy commute, some motivated students

review_title: best place to teach in central Iowa!
job_title: Associate Professor in Des Moines, IA
pros: As a full-time instructor at DMACC, I appreciated the collegial and professional environment as well as the institution's commitment to professional growth opportunities and student engagement.  DMACC fosters an upbeat, positive, and supportive environment for students and faculty.  Small class sizes + dedicated faculty = a great value in education for students.
cons: The community college environment can be a challenging place to teach for an adjunct faculty member.  I felt that adjunct faculty were well-supported, welcomed, and respected at DMACC.  Due to budget considerations, however, the number of courses that an adjunct could teach in a year were subject to limitations, making it necessary to teach at other institutions as well to make ends meet.

review_title: Good place to work.  Benefits are great and caring people.  Upper Mgmt cares too much about politics.
pros:
The co-workers for the most part are caring people who are there to help others get their degree.  the Staff at DMACC are without question committed to the students.  
Benefits are awesome!
Pay is ok
cons: Upper Mgmt cares way too much about politics.  And that filters down.  One day your doing something one way and the next day it completely changes because someone else has political pull at the moment.  It really drives the staff and teachers nuts.

pros: The campus in which I was employed was very "family" oriented. We all knew each other for the most part. The benefits were great as was the pay scale.
cons: Too many campuses and "voices". Thus, decision making within our department was sometimes a struggle. The hiring process is arduous also. A couple of times, very qualified candidates were no longer an option due to accepting positions elsewhere before we even got to the interview stage.

job_title: Computer Hardware Technician in Ankeny, IA
pros:
Flexible hours, they understand that most of their part-time employees are also students and they allow students to take time off if needed to complete homework.

Great co-workers: co-workers are very knowledgable and are always willing to lend a helping hand if they have the time.
cons: Hard to get a full-time position, and because of this, part-time employees are limited to working either 39 hours 6 months a week or 24 hours year-round.

pros: Everyone who works at Dmacc are dedicated and caring people whose true goal in life is to help all people that come thru their doors to achieve their goals and be successful in life.
cons: No down sides to going back to school to get a good education.

review_title: DMACC is a great place to work, but the hours I received were not enough to pay the bills.
job_title: IT Specialist in Des Moines, IA
pros: Good college.  Great people.  The training was satisfactory.
cons: The commute was long, and I could not obtain full-time status, so it was not fruitful in the end.

pros: Treated like full-time faculty by colleagues, given office space and access to same campus services as full-time faculty, opportunity to mentor students through Honors Program, pay is higher than other area institution for adjunct teaching, sub pay is generous
cons: administration seems disconnected from pedagological methods, no benefits if adjuncting is primary income

job_title: Lab Work in Des Moines, IA
pros: Good hours, nice work environment, Caring employer.  Overall I'd say this is the best place I've worked and the best wage.
cons: Its farther away from my house than I want to drive and the hours are the 9-5 type instead of the many shifts available elsewhere.

pros: Great bosses, good communication, fun environment, easy to adjust to their system and policies
cons: Low pay, the schedule is set for the trimester and you have to find someone to work for you if you are sick or unable to make it in.

review_title: Great organization to work for; great people
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in West Des Moines, IA
pros: DMACC is an awesome employer; the administration cares about their people—no matter their title or role—and the institution is well-run.
cons: I see little to answer here; overall, it was a great experience.

pros:
College cares about their students education
Instructors are given guidelines to follow but have the creativity to make their courses unique and exciting for their students
cons: Difficult to get a full-time position within specific departments
